results.title: The Devil's toy
results.creator_credit: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description: The skateboard gave the youngsters, who mastered its technique, a thrilling sensation of speed unexcelled by any other pavement sport. Filmed in 1966 on Montreal streets before the elongated rollerskate was banned, this film captures the exuberance of boys and girls having the time of their lives in free-wheeling downhill locomotion. Music by Pierre Brault. Sung by Genevieve Bujold.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Claude Jutra, Marcel Martin and National Film Board of Canada

results.title: A Day to remember
results.brief_description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.
results.description: A young CFA volunteer who spent her 21st birthday on duty during the bushfires of February 2009. Her entire family is involved in the CFA as volunteer firefighters. She speaks about the poignancy of seeing an Australian flag on a resident’s home during ‘Black Saturday’.

results.title: Let's talk cricket
results.creator_credit: ACMI Digital Storytelling and Alice Jackson Walsh
results.brief_description: Alice, a Gungarri Elder from Echuca, is the former president of the Campapse Cricket Association and Warma Indigenous Cricket Club. In this warm story she reminisces about her lifelong love affair with one of our national pastimes - and reveals its social importance and grass roots support by Australians.

results.title: The Burning question
results.creator_credit: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI
results.brief_description:
When David moved from the city, he fulfilled a lifetime dream to live in a place he had always visited and dreamed of owning. Losing almost all of his property, he is faced with a burning question in this first-hand account of the devastating Gippsland bushfires.
This Digital Storytelling project was created in partnership with Arts Victoria and Latrobe City.
results.creator_credit_for_label: David Guy, ACMI Digital Storytelling and ACMI

results.title: My Love
results.brief_description:
A personal account created by a participant in the ACMI Digital Storytelling Workshop “Against the Grain” in association with Partners in Grain (PING).
Almost 60 years old, Maureen Barry reminisces about her life, especially the last 35 years, of living on the land with the man she loves. From her youthful dreams as a young rural bride to the often harsh realiities of farm life in the sometimes unforgiving landscape of the Mallee. This story is dedicated to her husband, Brian.

results.title: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis
results.creator_credit: ACMI, Lisetta Moscardo and Helen Simondson
results.brief_description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.
results.description: Voula Messimeri-Kianidis is the current Chair for the Federation of Ethnic Communities’ Councils of Australia (FECCA) an Honour Roll inductee and Member of the Order of Australia (AM). She co-founded the Victorian Immigrant and Refugee Women’s Coalition (VIRWC) and has served as Chair of the Immigrant Women’s Domestic Violence Service, as Inaugural Chair of the Women in the North Service, as Council member at the RMIT University, as well as on a number of State and Federal advisory and policy structures.
